title: Identify the Unknown
text: The formula is $$3x+4y=10$$, and we want to find $$y$$.
speech: The formula is  3 x plus 4 y is equal to 10 , and we want to find  y .
pacedSpeech: The formula is   3 x plus 4 y is equal to 10
, and we want to find   y

title: Substitute
text: Since we know that $$x=\frac{14}{3}$$, we can substitute $$\frac{14}{3}$$ for $$x$$ into the equation and get $$3\left(\frac{14}{3}\right)+4y=10$$.
speech: Since we know that  x is equal to 14 thirds , we can substitute  14 thirds  for  x  into the equation and get , 3 times, parentheses 14 thirds  plus 4 y is equal to 10 .
pacedSpeech: Since we know that   x is equal to 14 thirds
into the equation and get  , 3 times,  14 thirds  plus 4 y is equal to 10

title: Simplify
speech: Simplifying the equation, we get , 14 plus 4 y, is equal to 10 .
pacedSpeech: Simplifying the equation, we get  , 14 plus 4 y, is equal to 10

title: Solve
text: To solve the equation, we can start by subtracting $$14$$ from both sides, which gives us the equation $$4y=-4$$.
speech: To solve the equation, we can start by subtracting , 14  from both sides, which gives us the equation  4 y, is equal to negative 4 .

from both sides, which gives us the equation   4 y, is equal to negative 4

title: Isolate
text: Now, we can divide both sides by $$4$$ to isolate $$y$$. What is $$y$$?
